title: The Truffle Thief's Last Course
premise: A disgraced, hyperosmic food critic—who can literally taste deception—is blackmailed into stealing a legendary, million-dollar white Alba truffle from a high-security culinary festival. To pull off the heist, she must assemble a crew of washed-up kitchen talents, but when the truffle vanishes before they can steal it, they must find the real thief to clear their names, navigating a world of obsessive chefs, corrupt gourmands, and deadly gastronomic secrets.
protagonist: Elara Vance, a former star critic whose career was destroyed by a scandal, now working under a pseudonym and burdened by a sensory condition that makes her taste the emotional 'truth' of any dish.
conflict: Elara must execute a seemingly impossible culinary heist to protect her hidden identity, only to become the prime suspect when the target is stolen by a rival. She must use her unique palate to 'taste-track' the thief through a series of elaborate meals, racing against time and a ruthless food syndicate that wants the truffle for a far more sinister purpose than mere consumption.
setting: Present-day, during the exclusive, week-long 'Omakase Gala' at the isolated, hyper-modern Skyvine Resort in the Napa Valley.
tone: Whip-smart, tense, and decadently sensory, blending the high-stakes planning of a heist thriller with the precise, passionate world of elite cuisine.
